reviews.text: Staff at the ticket office are helpful and friendly. The small cafe is nice but there are no vending machines, the cafe is closed on Sundays and the train station is some distance to any amenities. You need to get a taxi or bus into Yeovil from this station so it's not great late at night or at weekends.

I cannot  praise  this lovely station enough. 
It is one of 2 local stations  to us and the difference  is immense.
A special mention needs  to go to Jonathan in the ticket office. What a wonderful fellow  he is. Warm, kind and just goes that extra mile to make sure he has done whatever  is needed to solve your problem or query.
A second full marks goes to the coffee shop. It is kitted out in old fashioned style that takes you back to 'Brief Encounter. Beautiful tiles...thoughtfully and beautifully decorated  for Christmas and lovely, really lovely cheerful staff  ( no extra cost for extra  shots in coffees!).
I have to say, I have never come across a station like it.
Thank you to all who make it lovely. I'm sure I'm  not the only one who appreciates it. Again Jonathan deserves  an extra mention. Full marks .
So far so good. Food available from cafe. Small cafe but nice offering hot and cold food tea and coffee. I think WiFi is available but I couldn't get it to work. Car park large.

If you're going to include a bus transfer as part of my rail journey, and then not include the cost in the price of my ticket, the very least you could do is make sure the bus stop is clearly signposted and maintained.
